jgame.controller

Class PolygonController

  • java.lang.Object
    • jgame.controller.AbstractLocRotController
      • jgame.controller.PolygonController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Controller

    public class PolygonController
extends AbstractLocRotController
    A controller allowing an object to follow a polygon. This controller is irregular in that its max speed actually determines its slowness; more precisely, the value of AbstractLocRotController.getMaxSpeed() is the number of frames needed to traverse each edge of the polygon.
    Author:
    William Chargin

      • PolygonController

        public PolygonController(java.awt.Polygon p)
        Creates the polygon controller.

      • PolygonController

        public PolygonController(java.awt.Polygon p,
                         boolean rotateToFollow,
                         int rotationOffset)
        Creates the polygon controller with the specified rotation settings.
        Parameters:
        p - the polygon used for the controller
        rotateToFollow - whether the controller should rotate the object to follow the path
        rotationOffset - the rotation offset (default is 0)

    • Method Detail

      • goToStart

        public void goToStart(GObject target)
        Positions and rotates the target object at the start of the path. It is recommended that you invoke this method after creating the controller, because otherwise there may be a frame in which the object is still at its default location and rotation, before jumping to the start of the path.
        Parameters:
        target - the object to modify

      • assertPolygonHasAtLeastTwoPoints

        private void assertPolygonHasAtLeastTwoPoints(java.awt.Polygon p)
                                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Asserts that the given polygon has at least two points, and throws an exception if this is not the case.
        Parameters:
        p - the polygon to check
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if p.npoints < 2

      • calculateControl

        protected java.awt.geom.Point2D calculateControl(GObject target,
                                                 Context context)
        Description copied from class: AbstractLocRotController
        Calculates the required control the given object with the given context. This method will only be invoked after an immediately preceding call to AbstractLocRotController.canControl(GObject, Context) with the same parameters, and only if said method call returns true.
        Specified by:
        calculateControl in class AbstractLocRotController
        Parameters:
        target - the object to control
        context - the context
        Returns:
        a point representing the displacement as a result of the transform in the form new Point(dx, dy), where dx is the displacement in the positive x direction and dy is the displacement in the positive y direction

      • canControl

        protected boolean canControl(GObject target,
                             Context context)
        Description copied from class: AbstractLocRotController
        Determines whether the given target can be controlled in the given context.
        Specified by:
        canControl in class AbstractLocRotController
        Parameters:
        target - the target
        context - the context
        Returns:
        true if the target can be controlled, or false if it cannot
